title: Absolute Beginner Bodyweight Workout (No Weights, No Jumping) | Joanna Soh
description:
Download my Fitness App here: https://www.fiolife.com/ SUBSCRIBE: http://bit.ly/SUBJoannaSoh | Follow my IG: https://instagram.com/joannasohofficial/

Here's an ABSOLUTE BEGINNER BODYWEIGHT workout to get you started. No weights, no jumping!  We will be focusing on simple beginner exercises to target every major muscle group; thighs, bums, core, arms, shoulders, back and chest. You’ll be guided through each exercise to make sure that you're executing proper form and get the results you deserve.

Duration: 30 minutes
Sequence: 40 secs Work - 20 secs Rest (x3 circuits)
Estimated Calories: 250 - 300 Calories 
**this depends on your body composition - weight, height, age, body fat percentage,  activity level

CIRCUIT 1
1) Squat
2) Reverse Lunge with Rotation
3) Cursty Lunge Pulldown
4) Squat to Lunge

CIRCUIT 2
1) Knee Push-up
2) Tricep Dip
3) Superman
4) Knee Push-up to Superman

CIRCUIT 3
1) Russian Twist
2) Single Leg Knee Tuck
3) Mountain Climber 
4) Plank

________________

channelDescription:
Hi! I’m Joanna Soh & welcome to my channel. I’m a certified Personal Trainer (ACE), Nutrition Coach and Women’s Fitness Specialist (NASM). I've been in the fitness industry for over 10 years! I’ve also recently earned my Masters in Mental Health / Psychological Medicine.

On my channel, you can find workout videos, recipes, nutritional tips and advice on healthy eating, as well as videos talking about mental health. I truly believe that total wellness is not just keeping the body healthy, but the mind is equally as important. I hope my videos will help you reach your fitness goals and achieve the healthy lifestyle you’ve always dreamed about.

embedHtml: <iframe width="480" height="270" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/g_CttGc-_2E" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" referrerpolicy="strict-origin-when-cross-origin" allowfullscreen></iframe>
comments:
5 months ago I left a comment here about bursting into tears after completing this workout. This was because this workout made me understand how out of shape I was due to having given up on my healthy habits (including physical exercise) because of work stress. Today, 5 months later I did this workout again and would now like to give an update.
It took some time but 2 months ago I finally turned my life around and started working out every single day. Not much, just 10-25 minutes a time. Sometimes it's a similar workout to this, other days a bit of yoga or just stretching. I feel so much better and happier now! My body doesn't hurt anymore. I don't struggle walking the stairs anymore. I feel a bit more like my old self.
This workout is still challenging for me (my arms are shaking right now lol) but it's manageable!
If you're feeling down and/or uncomfortable in your body then just know that 10-15 minutes can make a big difference in your life! :) Good luck!

I used to exercise regularly and be quite fit. However, a lot has changed and today I could barely finish this workout. After completing it I burst into tears - on the one hand because I was happy and proud for exercising after such a long break but also because I was miserable about having lost most of my muscle tone and endurance. So in case anyone needs this reminder: If your work stress or some other stress is so bad that you don't have time or energy for your healthy habits anymore, it's time to make a change! Your health is your most precious asset!

I love that she's also showing what NOT to do - as someone who is a total beginner and exercising alone, I'm always doubting whether I'm doing things correctly and her showing what to keep an eye on helps tremendously.

0:50 Warm-up
3:15 Circuit 1: Lower body
6:58 Circuit 1: Repeat
11:01 Take a One Minute Break
11:42 Circuit 2: Upper Body
15:45 Circuit 2: Repeat
19:52 Take a One Minute Break
20:20 Circuit 3: Core Muscles
24:28 Circuit 3: Repeat
28:56 Cool Down

You did it!!! One step closer to getting the body you want 😊

I'm gonna do this exercise every day now and... ( I'm 75 kg , 5feet and half inch)
Day 1 : couldn't do it... Left halfway in circuit 1 itself but felt the burn so much
Day 2: did the whole thing, felt that the mountain climber was really hard.... It's still hard even after 15 days.... I'm gonna increase my muscle too..
Day 3: did the whole thing but took a two min break just before circuit practice 2 because lf distractions... It felt easier than yesterday 😅
Day 4:

Guys like this so I can come back and update 🥰
